intro: Boechera atrorubens, commonly known as the purple-rayed rockcress, is a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its basal leaves and small, showy purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Boechera atrorubens is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
